info.readme:
This is the complete website package to the tutorial Razor Estate Agents Starter Site that has been published in the .NET Magazine.
The tutorial featured in the .NET magazine will guide you from start to finish on how to create a HTML5 responsive website for Estate Agents.
This project will be used to give you the necessary files to build your own Estate Agent website or if you wish to download the completed project if you wish and is specifically aimed at complete beginners to the Umbraco platform and will be a good starting point to learn the fundamentals of Umbraco.

Home.pageTitle: My Estate Agent - An Umbraco Website built for .NET Magazine
Home.metaDescription: This is an example HTML5 & CSS3 website built for a tutorial in the .NET Magazine

Textpage.bodyText:
This estate agent demo site was built for a tutorial for .NET Magazine by the wonderful guys at the Umbraco HQ to help you learn about the ASP.NET Open Source CMS Umbraco.

What is Umbraco?

Umbraco is a free Open Source ASP.NET CMS that allows you to have 100% total control over your markup.

If you look at the markup for this site you will see it uses HTML5 & CSS3 to create a responsive website. Umbraco doesn't force you to use any specific markup. If you wanted to go all retro and create a <table> based design with tons of spacer.gifs to remind you of the good ole days of web design then you can, but obviously we don't recommend it ;)

There is nothing worse than a CMS deciding what markup you should use. That's why we give you 100% control over templating and output, with no limitations to your design.

Who is using Umbraco?

Umbraco runs over 110 thousand active umbraco installations. This number is not development or trial websites and powers sites from large corporatiosn to small companies.

Some of the companies currently using Umbraco:

  • Wired.co.uk
  • GQ.co.uk
  • Heinz.com
  • Sandisk.com
  • TakeThat.com

How do I find out more?

You can find out more about Umbraco by visting the Umbraco website and its community website where you can find and install addons to Umbraco, ask questions on the forum, meetup up with other Umbraco users & read through documentation on the wiki at http://our.umbraco.org

Estate.otherDetails:
What a great opportunity for those with both young & teenage families. This large home offers space for everyone.

Family cooking will be a breeze in the kitchen which utilizes the latest trend of 'open air culinary preperation', leading into a bright and breezy dining area, not to mention a large secure sunny garden with un-challenged views.

The contemporary 'green' decor will not only show your friends your staunch position on being ecologically friendly, you really will feel every night as if you are falling asleep under the stars. In fact the bedroom layout has been cleverly designed so walls may be moved to configure a number of different designs.

Parking is ample with the added benefits of extra space for the boat or extra cars. 

A great family home with so much to offer ..... elevated for sun & fabulous entertaining areas with space for the children to run & play safely. 

Opportunities like this seldom appear - make sure you don't miss out ....

The saying goes that a man's home is his castle and never has this been more true than with this very special property.

Built in 1705 and owned exclusively by one family until it's current sale, this home has gone through quite a number of additions and alterations in the last two centuries although we can guarantee all have been permitted and passed by council.

No dodgy add-ons here!  Situated in the very exclusive City of Westminster, this stately home boasts 775 rooms. These include 19 State rooms, 52 bedrooms, 188 staff bedrooms, 92 offices and 78 bathrooms.  Unfortunately any staff needed to maintain said number of rooms is not included in the sale of the home and are to be provided at the new owners discretion.

The beautiful grounds stretch well over 40 acres and due to the previous owners fondness for dogs is well fenced and coincidentally, well fertilized, producing a wealth of both floral and edible delights for it's new owner. If this could be you, don't delay, call us today!

You'd have to be living under a rock the last decade if you havn't caught onto the latest in home trends.... "church conversions".  The opportunity exists for a limited time only to purchase the ultimate in church conversion property. 

Now it could be your home if you don't delay and call me today.  It is true that church conversions aren't easy projects to take on board.  The integrity of the structure, architecture, and many of the artifacts and art cannot be touched or changed in anyway. 

You may be called upon by members of the royal family to lend it to them for an hour or two should a wedding or other such occasion arise. 

Sundays will be social affairs as thousands flock to mass in your front living room. It is not for the faint hearted.  Interested?  Call me today to discuss your options.

If one has any sense, or sensibility, you will make sure to come and check out this charming little cottage.

Owned once by a charming female writer who gained popularity writing novels surrounding the particulars and peculiarities of society and romance in pre-industrial England, you are sure to fall in love and be more than a little romanced by the beautiful gardens and charming interiors.

A 17th centuary house situated in Chawton, the home is complete with beautiful drawing room, cozy fireplace, 6 bedrooms and a well appointed bathroom. Don't let the fact this home is Heritage listed put you off, we are fairly certain council will be releasing it to the public soon enough.... buy now, and when it is it's sure to be a worthy investment!

Before I tell you about the many, many fantastic features of this centuries old home, let me whet your appetite by revealing that THIS home is perched upon it's own extinct volcano!  Exciting?  We've only just begun! 

Built of time tested materials and oozing olde year Scottish character and charm, this beautiful home has a lot of love to give it's newest owners. 

This large, open plan property is perfect for families of all ages and stages.  Boasting many bathrooms and twice again number of bedrooms, those willing to put in a bit of work to modernize the decor will reap the rewards. 

This could also be the perfect 'work from home' or 'home and income' opportunity so popular in today's property market with plenty of room for a home office or an exchange student or two to help pay the mortgage. 

Did we mention it has it's own dog cemetery?!  Want to know more?  Contact us now!

Anyone can buy a piece of land to build their dream home on, but what about owning your own lake? 

House boats are the latest in celebrity trends with artists such as Britney Spears and Usher opting for the elegance and freedom that living on the water affords.  Land owners are catching on quick and are now offering up lakes, rivers and estuary's for astute buyers to add to their property portfolio. 

Our agency is proud to have on its books a very special body of water, a large, deep, freshwater loch, situated in the heart of the Scottish Highlands. Included in the sale is a large house-boat, comprising of 3 roomy sleeping quarters, a sizeable galley kitchen and two bathrooms equipped with heated towel rails and double spa baths. 

Owners will even throw in the cryptozoological Loch Ness Monster, also known affectionately as "Nessie" for free.  Call me today!

If owning your own piece of Irish history sounds like your kind of deal, have I got the deal for you! The interior is in ruins, the structural integrity is questionable, but if you don't shy away from a little hard work this may just be the renovation pay off of the last century (or 2)!

With 13 bedrooms, a throne room, what may have once been 3 bathrooms, a banquet hall and a decent sized dungeon, there is something for everyone in your family at this property. And for little Jimmy who suffers from that terrible stutter, this home even features it's own medieval stone which, if hung upside-down over a sheer drop to kiss, is said to give the gift of eloquence. Priceless! Do it for the kids! Call me today.

Template.Name: Search
Template.Design:
<%@ Master Language="C#" MasterPageFile="~/masterpages/Master.master" AutoEventWireup="true" %>

Search Results

@{ //Get the values posted from the form var locationID = Request.Form["location"]; var price = Request.Form["price"]; var noRooms = Request.Form["noRooms"]; var noBathrooms = Request.Form["noBathrooms"]; //Check if locationID is null from the posted form data... if(locationID == null) { //If it is null then the form was not posted and the page was visited directly

Please use the search to find properties.

//Stop all other code running in this Macro return; } //Replace £ and spaces price = price.Replace("£",""); price = price.Replace(" ",""); //Split the min & max value on the - character var prices = price.Split('-'); //Retrieve the min & max values from the split & convert them to interger numbers var minPrice = Convert.ToInt32(prices[0]); var maxPrice = Convert.ToInt32(prices[1]); //Define the search query (replace the placeholders with our values) var searchQuery = string.Format("price >= {0} && price <= {1} && bedrooms >= {2} && bathrooms >= {3}", minPrice, maxPrice, noRooms, noBathrooms); //Setup variables for us to use var location = String.Empty; dynamic estatesToSearch; //If the locationID is -1 (any) then... if(locationID == "-1") { //Set the location name to any location = "any"; //Search for all estates using our searchQuery estatesToSearch = Model.AncestorOrSelf("Home").Descendants("Estate").Where(searchQuery); } else { //Get the name of the location from the nodeID location = Library.NodeById(locationID).Name; //Search for estates under a specific location Node estatesToSearch = Library.NodeById(locationID).Descendants("Estate").Where(searchQuery); } }

You searched for estates in @location area, with a minimum of @noRooms bedrooms and @noBathrooms bathrooms,
with a price range between @string.Format("{0:c}",minPrice) and @string.Format("{0:c}",maxPrice).

@if(estatesToSearch.Count() == 0) {

We found no estates for your search. Try widening your search.

} @foreach(var estate in estatesToSearch) { //Get the first image of the estate available var imageNode = @estate.Children.First(); var imageURL = imageNode.image;

@estate.Name
@string.Format("{0:c}",estate.price)

}

Template.Name: Search Estates (Called by template alias from JS only)
Template.Design:
<%@ Master Language="C#" MasterPageFile="~/umbraco/masterpages/default.master" AutoEventWireup="true" %>

<asp:Content ContentPlaceHolderID="ContentPlaceHolderDefault" runat="server">
    <umbraco:Macro Language="cshtml" runat="server">
        @{
            //Get the ?nodeID= value from the querystring
            var nodeId = Request.QueryString["nodeId"];

            //If nodeID is doesn't exist then...
            if (nodeId == null) {
                //Use our helper PropertySearch by passing in all Estate nodes under the Home node
                @EstateSearch(Model.AncestorOrSelf("Home").Descendants("Estate"))
            }
            else {
                //Get the loacationArea from the nodeID querystring variable
                var locationArea = @Library.NodeById(nodeId);

                //Use our helper PropetySearch by passing in the property children under the LocationArea
                @EstateSearch(locationArea.Children)
            }
        }      
    
        
        @helper EstateSearch(dynamic estates) 
        {
            //This is our helper to generate our JSON for our JS script

            //Setup variables to store our values
            var prices      = new List<int>();
            var bedrooms    = new List<int>();
            var bathrooms   = new List<int>();

            //For each Estate in Estates
            foreach (var estate in estates)
            {
                prices.Add(estate.Price);
                bedrooms.Add(estate.Bedrooms);
                bathrooms.Add(estate.Bathrooms);
            }

            //Build up our JSON string...
            var result = "{ ";
                result += "\"minPrice\": " + prices.Min() + ", ";
                result += "\"maxPrice\": " + prices.Max() + ", ";

                result += "\"minBedrooms\": " + bedrooms.Min() + ", ";
                result += "\"maxBedrooms\": " + bedrooms.Max() + ", ";

                result += "\"minBathrooms\": " + bathrooms.Min() + ", ";
                result += "\"maxBathrooms\": " + bathrooms.Max();
            result +=  " }";

            //Output the JSON string to the page
            @Html.Raw(result)
        }
    </umbraco:Macro>
</asp:Content>
